login.title: Login
login.titleInfo: Use your MCSManager account to login.

login.isNull: Username or Password cannot be empty.

instances.selectRemoteTitle: Please choose a daemon from the drop-down menu.
instances.selectRemoteInfo: Daemon on localhost will be selected by default. The MCSManager daemon could be deployed on any remote host, help you to manage a distribute system at one place.
instances.notAnyInstanceTitle: No data, please use the green 'New Instance' button on the top right to create one.
instances.notAnyInstanceInfo: An instance could be a Minecraft server, or any other application. The instance will be deployed to the selected daemon after creation.

dialog.commandCloseInfo: The actual command that executed when stopping the server
dialog.inputOrOutputCodeInfo: Used when console is outputing unrecognizable characters. e.g. GBK or UTF-8.

instances.UnableToConnectInfo: Auth failed, please try refresh the page.

types.name: Minecraft Server: Java Edition
types.desc: For server core in JAR format (e.g. Spigot/Bungeecord).

types.name: Minecraft Server: Bedrock Edition
types.desc: For Minecraft Bedrock Dedicated Server or other server core in binary format.

types.name: General Game Server
types.desc: For most private game servers. There is no guarantee for absolute compatibility.

types.name: General Console Application
types.desc: For any command-line application like bash, cmd.exe, app.exe, or start.sh.

newInstances.selectCreateType: How would you like to proceed?
newInstances.selectCreateTypeInfo: Choose the first option if you only want to create a game server. The other options are used for different scenarios.

createTypes.name: Upload single server core (Recommended).
createTypes.desc: For the first time creation. You only need to upload a server core and the relative files will be created automatically during first run.

createTypes.name: Upload a server archive.
createTypes.desc: For existing server or mod pack. The archive will be decompressed automatically. Only support zip format.

createTypes.name: Upload nothing or select existing file.
createTypes.desc: The server does not require files to run or the required file(s) already existed on remote machine. You only need to manually set the startup command and working directory.

newInstances.instanceNameInfo2: Instance name, please choose a unique name.
newInstances.commandTemplateText: ${ProgramName} represents files you need to upload. You don't need to change these in general.
newInstances.fileDirInfo: Optional. Please use absolute path if you need to change this(e.g C:/Servers/MyServer).
newInstances.autoCreate: The panel will create and manage automatically by default.
newInstances.uploadFileInfo: Server core refers to executable in format JAR/EXE （like Spigot.jar or Paper.jar）
newInstances.afterUpload: Instance will be created after finish uploading file.
newInstances.launchCmdInfo: Unable to recognize server core. Please manually set the startup command.
newInstances.launchCmdInfo2: Please manually set the startup command.
newInstances.uploadZipInfo: Only support zip format archive. The archive will be automatically decompressed to working directory.
newInstances.upFileInfo: Instance will be created automatically after file uploading. If you upload an archive, it will be decompressed to the working directory. It might take some time for decompression to complete.
newInstances.selectFromExist: Choose your server from the existing file(s).
newInstances.selectFromExistInfo: File must be present on the daemon host (not the panel host)
newInstances.afterFlieName: Before starting the server, please enter the server core file name and upload it via file management tab.
newInstances.nowYouCan: You can now edit instance configuration.
newInstances.toEditInfo: It is recommended to configure the settings now. For example: Docker profile, encoding, and working directory.
newInstances.pleaseFinish: Please set the basic configurations before uploading files.
newInstances.uploadAndCreate: Irreversible operation: The instance will be created as you upload file(s). This is a irreversible operation, would you like to proceed?
newInstances.instantWillBeCreate: The instance will be created, would you like to proceed?

instancesDetail.title: Instance Detailed Configuration
instancesDetail.titleInfo: The current page is only available to administrators. The application instance are capable to perform remote code execution, please be careful.

distribute.title: Assign to other users
distribute.no: Not recommended, might be harmful to the host

instancesDetail.instanceTypeInfo: Different instance type will lead to differnt functionality. For general purpose, you coulld choose an abstracted instance type(e.g. Java general server).
instancesDetail.launchCmdText:
Apply to any command: use double quotes for parameters or directories that contains space. The inner string will be treated as a whole. The command should not contains a new line.
If a command does not respond, or the output characters are unrecognizable, try enable the emulation terminal.
Different instance type will lead to differnt functionality. For general purpose, you coulld choose an abstracted instance type(e.g. Java general server).
In general, we recommend using command helper to generate startup command. However, you can also use customized commands.
For example "C: \Program Files\Java\bin\java.exe" -Dfile.encoding=utf-8 -Djline.terminal=jline.UnsupportedTerminal -jar "my server.jar" -nogui
instancesDetail.cwdInfo: Working directory for instance. Bothe relative and absolute path are acceptable.
instancesDetail.updateCmdInfo: When an user execute update/install operation, this command will be executed. ${mcsm_workspace} is the working directory, leave empty for disable this function.
instancesDetail.ieInfo: Command encoding, will be applied after instance restart
instancesDetail.oeInfo: Terminal output encoding, will be applied after instance restart
instancesDetail.launchTypeInfo: Should be defaullt in general. If the panel is for commercial purpose, docker should be used, otherwise the host might be compromised.
instancesDetail.dockerConfigInfo: A virtualization environment based on Docker. It provides a sandbox environment for each container. The sandbox will be disposed after use to ensure the safety of the host.
instancesDetail.openPortInfo: Use space for multiple port. <port on host>:<port of container>.
instancesDetail.extraVolumesInfo: Mount extra directory into container. Use space for multiple directories. <Directory on host>:<Directory to be mounted in container>
instancesDetail.containerNameInfo: Container name, leave empty for randomly generated
instancesDetail.containerNameTooltip: Optional. Leave this empty in general
instancesDetail.netModeInfo: Choose how the container connect to network. (e.g. bridge)
instancesDetail.netAliasesInfo: Used for inter-communication between containers in customized network, use space to separate.
instancesDetail.netAliasesTooltip: Optional, leave empty for in general
instancesDetail.limitCpuInfo: Limit the total CPU usage, might be biased a little.
instancesDetail.limitCpuTooltip: Use 50 to limit all core usage to 50%. User 200 to limit all core usage to 200% (relative to single core performance).
instancesDetail.cpuSetCpusInfo: Limit container to run on specified CPU core.
instancesDetail.cpuSetCpusTooltip: Limit process to run on specified CPU core(s). It might allocate your system resources in a better way. For example 0,1 to limit running on the first and second core, use comma between different coures.
instancesDetail.maxMemInfo: For example 1024 or 2048. Use pure digits here.
instancesDetail.startError: The startup command could not contain new lines. Please limit your command to only one line.
instancesDetail.cantGetImageList: Failed to fetch image list from Daemon, please create new image in service environment
instancesDetail.cantGetNetModeList: Unable to fetch network list from Daemon, please check your Docker configuration.

pingConfig.title2: Better query the status of server status

pingConfig.inputAddr: Required, accept IP or FQDN. Leave empty to not query server information.

eventConfigPanel.title: Event Triggered Tasks
eventConfigPanel.autoRestartInfo:
Start the server immediately if it was stopped for any reason other than the 'Stop' button.
Could be used to restart a crashed server.
eventConfigPanel.autoStartInfo:
Automatically start the instance with daemon.
Could be used to start server automatically during a system restart.

unavailableTerminal.title: Connection Daemon Error
unavailableTerminal.browserCannotConnect: The browser is unable to connect to
unavailableTerminal.browserCannotConnect2: The browser is unable to establish connection to "Daemon"
unavailableTerminal.maybe: Possibly due to a blocked port or the usage of local IP.
unavailableTerminal.solutions:
• Make sure that the address used by the "Daemon" is a public network address, and the port of the "Daemon" has been opened.
  • If you use intranet mapping or other network modes, you must ensure that both your browser and the panel can connect to the "Daemon".
  • If there is HTTPS, etc., please use the wss:// protocol to connect to the "Daemon".

terminal.cantConnectTerm: Failed to establish connection to the terminal
terminal.cantSendCmdBecauseData: Unable to execute command: data channel unavailable
terminal.cantSendCmdBecauseNotRun: Unable to execute command: sever not running

processConfig.title: Configure List Group
processConfig.aboutConfigInfo: It is a combined effort by the development team and the community to support the configurations. The corresponding author was showed under the 'Module Author' section. For multiple configuration file with the same name, the corresponding server core was appended at the beginning of the config file. Please manually choose the server type.
processConfig.noConfigFileInfo: No config file found for instance with type ({type}). Please consider initialize the configuration or change the instance type.
processConfig.author: Module Author
processConfig.unknownCompatible: The panel are unable to confirm the compatibility of this config file, please use at your own risk.

processConfigFile.title: Configuration File
processConfigFile.noFile: Unable to view the file: file not exist or incorrect permission. Please try edit in the file management or restart the instance.

termSet.title: Terminal Settings
termSet.ptyInfo:
The terminal is fully interactive by emulating the terminal forwarding program.
Including the use of Tab, Ctrl function keys, etc.
termSet.ifHaveProblems: If there is a problem with the use, it is recommended to close it.
termSet.ptySize: Size of the emulated terminal window
termSet.ptySizeInfo: It takes effect when the emulated terminal is turned on. It is used to set the height and width of the emulated terminal. The instance needs to be restarted for changes to take effect.
termSet.WebColorInfo:
The web page automatically adds color rendering to the output content, and the rendered color may not be completely correct.
If the color rendering function conflicts with the color function that comes with the software, you can turn off this function.
termSet.stopCmdInfo: When the "Close Instance" button is clicked, this command will be executed immediately, ^C stands for Ctrl+C signal.
termSet.crlfInfo: If you enter a command and press enter and nothing happens, try adjusting this option.
termSet.crlfInfo2: It is usually "carriage return and line feed" under Windows platform, and "line feed" under Linux/MacOS platform.
termSet.ioCodeInfo: If the content in the console is garbled, you can try to modify this code to solve the problem.
termSet.setUpdate: The instance configuration has been updated, some configurations may need to restart the instance to take effect
termSet.fontSizeInfo: The default is 13px, after the change, refresh the page to take effect

userDetail.aboutNameInfo: Every username is unique. The system will check for uniqueness while editing username. Please do not use special characters or those that are not compatible with the old version systems.
userDetail.aboutPasswdInfo: Please use as complicate password as you can. Your host provide will not be able to view your plain password, and you do not need to worry too much about password similarity with other applications.
userDetail.aboutApiKeyInfo: The API token for developers has the same permission level as your password. Please make sure the token was stored in a safely place.
userDetail.newPasswdInfo: The length must be from 9 to 24. Use symbols, numbers, and letters.
userDetail.apiKeyIs: For development purpose. It provides the best reliability and same permission level for your third-party applications.
userDetail.changeThisInfo: Are you sure you want to change this?
userDetail.inputPasswd: Pleae provde your password. Leave empty for no change.
userDetail.notStandard: Incorrect password length, has to be 9 to 36.

services.remoteInfo:
The Daemon (on any virtual/physical host) must be online and connected to each other. Corresponding port(s) and correct token need to be configured for connection from the Web Interface(Panel).
The Web page (i.e. your browser) needs to be able to connect directly to the Daemon(via opened port) for functions like uploading, downloading, and console to work. Please avoid using any LAN IP other than localhost, the daemon has to be connected via public IP or FQDN.
Corresponding daemon version for current Web Interface：{ specifiedDaemonVersion }
services.remoteIPSub: has to be public IP or localhost, otherwise your won't be able to connect to the daemon correctly.
services.keySub: Token will be displayed when the Daemon started, pleae make sure it is stored safely.

addNewWarn.title: Warning for Adding New Daemon
addNewWarn.ip: Detected current connected IP as: { newServiceInfo }, perhaps it is a LAN IP?
addNewWarn.outerNet: Both web interface and Daemon has to be reachable directly by the user in order to lower the load of the central control panel.
addNewWarn.whyOuterNet: Why a public IP is required to connect to Daemon?
addNewWarn.because:
To lower the load of the central control panel (web panel), we have to re-distrubute the traffics to their corresponding daemon. That is, the traffic will go directly from the web page(your browser) to the Daemon.
Therefore, every daemon has to be reachable from the public internet (even they were in the same LAN), and you have to use public IP to access the instance on this daemon as well.
addNewWarn.KeepIntranet: Are you sure you inisist to use LAN IP to connect?
addNewWarn.ifTrueThen: Part of the instance functionality will be unavailable with a LAN IP.

principlePanel.title: Distribute service model
principlePanel.desc:
To lower the load of the the central control panel(web panel), we use a 'redirect command & direct data' model
This design will expose each daemon to the public internet. However, the service on each daemon was meant to be exposed in the first place. With managed permission system, there is no need to worry the security of the host.
principlePanel.onlyOne: If you only have one host, you can ignore the service model and use as it is.

services.delDaemonWarn: This operation will PERMANENTLY delete this Daemon, would you like to proceed?
services.inputNewKey: Please provide new token, the panel will automatically attempt to connect with new token later.
services.keySub2: Linux, the token is usually in /opt/mcsmanager/daemon/data/Config/global.json

imageManager.waitForDel: Please wait patiently, the image will be deleted shortly. You can refresh the page to reload the list.

newImage.need10min: It may take several minutes to create new images, please wait patiently.
newImage.whatIsImageInfo: Because Minecraf or other applications requires specific running environment (e.g. JAVA/PYTHON/.NET). With environment image, we can manage different environment used by different types of servers in different container easily.
newImage.whatIsDocker: What is Docker? Why we need it?
newImage.whatIsDockerInfo: Docker is a light-weight virtualization environment. It create sandbox contains to isolate your application. Whatever the application do, it will not harm the host system.

settings.updateSetInfo: Some config will be effective only after panel restart.
settings.languageSettingInfo: The control panel will synchronize all daemons and interfaces to the new language.
settings.accessPortInfo: The port for the web page. This port has to be opened/forwarded to access the web interface. New port will be effective after restart.
settings.bindIPInfo: Do not change this in general, used for snarios where multiple NICs present.
settings.inputIP: Defaullt 0.0.0.0  INo need to change this in general.
settings.loginPage: Brief Introduction for the Login Page
settings.loginPageInfo: Used to display brief information at the login page. Could be used to display ICP records or administrator information.
settings.referenceLinksInfo: In general, most of the configurations should be in their default value. Do not change any settings unless you absolutely know what you are doing.
settings.canFileManager: Allow normal users to use file management
settings.canFileManagerInfo: File management is a complicate and resource-consuming (like file compression) function. You can disable this function for normal users if they do don't have to modify any files.
settings.crossAPIInfo: 'access-control-allow-origin: *' will be joined to the HTTP respond. It might lower the security but provides flexibility for additional development.
settings.loginCheckIpInfo: This will protect the your panel from brute force password hacking from the same origin. Each IP will only be allowed 10 retries.
settings.attentionInfo:
Professional knowledge may be needed for these settings. You can set those value accordingly based on your hardware.
the default value will be good for most purpose. However, for a seamless user experience under large-scale deployment, you may need beter hardware or higher default values.
settings.aboutTitleInfo: This protocol allows everyone to copy and modify copies of the code and can charge user fees for services.
settings.sponsorListInfo: Only shows the first 40 donators. For a full list of donators, please go to
settings.settingUpdate: Updated, some options may require a panel restart.
settings.aboutTitle2: You may copy or modify the source code, but you must keep all the copyright notice and attach it Powered by MCSManager.

businessWarning.title: Warning for Commercial Use
businessWarning.warningInfo: If you assign instance to strangers under Windows/Linux, your host could be compromised by others via malicious software they upload.
businessWarning.hotToProtect: How could I protect my host?
businessWarning.protectInfo:
Your host OS must be Linux, and Docker was installed. You could find Process Launch Type ath the bottom-right corner of instance settings. You can ensure your host's safety by switching the launch type to isolated/dockerized container.
The Docker container will run your instance(s) in an isolated sandbox environment. Whatever malicious software your user uploads and executes will not affect other users or your host.

cmdAssist.javaPathInfo: If you want to specify specific Java program, you can use absolute path here. e.g. C:\ProgramFiles\Java\jdk-16.0.1\bin\java.exe
cmdAssist.javaPathInput: Optional, java will be used by default
cmdAssist.programNameInfo: The actual file name of your server core in the working directory. e.g. Paper.jar, Server.jar.
cmdAssist.xmxInfo: The -Xmx parameter of Java. A unit must be provided. e.g. 1024M, 2G
cmdAssist.inputXmx: Optional, leave this empty and java will manage it automatically.
cmdAssist.xmsInfo: The -Xms parameter of Java. A unit must be provided. e.g. 1024M, 2G
cmdAssist.additionalInfo: parameters before -jar of startup command. e.g. '-server'
cmdAssist.suffixInfo: parameters after -jar of startup command. e.g. '-nogui'
cmdAssist.binaryFileName: File name of the binary executable
cmdAssist.programName2Info: The program must already existed in the working directory or PATH. e.g. cmd.exe, bash, program.exe
cmdAssist.additionalInfo2: Different program has different types of parameters. Some general examples: -o -c --option, separated by space.
cmdAssist.noContent: Please fill in all reauired field(s)
cmdAssist.noLinuxBds: We are unable to generate a correct startup command for current Linux environment, please set it manually.

Container.notSupportWindowsTip: Only supports Docker container management under Linux
Container.info: All Docker-based containers and mirrors can be managed here. After the mirror is created, the specified mirror can be assigned to the instance to ensure the isolation of the operating environment and the security of the host.
